title: 103_s2561
content: The "Housing Programs Extension Act of 1994" may be cited as the short title. This Act provides housing assistance. The "Housing Programs Extension Act of 1994" allows the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to offer a 24-month extension to expiring Section 8 contracts for housing projects, with terms and conditions remaining the same as the original contract. The "Housing Programs Extension Act of 1994" allows the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to provide displacement assistance to tenants in units covered by expiring Section 8 contracts that are not extended. This assistance can be in the form of tenant-based assistance or a unit with project-based assistance under Section 8 of the United States Housing Act of 1937. The Housing Programs Extension Act of 1994 authorizes appropriations for low-income housing preservation and resident homeownership. It includes amendments to the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 regarding acquisition grants and technical assistance. Additionally, it allows for the use of Section 236 Rental Assistance Fund amounts for flexible subsidies. Subsidies under the National Housing Act and housing counseling provisions are amended to extend deadlines to September 30, 1995. Amendments also address reconstruction of public housing for disabled families. The National Housing Act subsidies and housing counseling provisions are amended to extend deadlines to September 30, 1995, including changes to public housing reconstruction for disabled families. U.S.C. 1437e(j)(2)(G)(i) is amended to update the fiscal year to 1995. SEC. 3. Rural housing provisions amended for fiscal year 1995. SEC. 4. Changes to mortgage insurance and secondary mortgage market programs. SEC. 4. Mortgage insurance and secondary mortgage market programs are amended to include changes for fiscal year 1995. Multifamily housing finance and assessment collection dates for the Office of Federal Housing Enterprise Oversight are updated. SEC. 5. COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT. Amendment to the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act regarding fiscal years after 1995.
